clinical_guidelines.organization: American Heart Association, American College of Cardiology, Heart Failure Society of America
clinical_guidelines.scope: Comprehensive management of heart failure in adults

key_recommendations.recommendation: ACE inhibitors or ARBs are recommended for all patients with heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF) to reduce morbidity and mortality
key_recommendations.evidence_summary: Multiple large randomized trials demonstrate consistent benefit

key_recommendations.recommendation: Beta-blockers are recommended for all stable patients with HFrEF to reduce mortality and hospitalization
key_recommendations.evidence_summary: Meta-analysis of major trials shows 35% reduction in mortality

key_recommendations.recommendation: SGLT2 inhibitors are reasonable for patients with HFrEF to reduce cardiovascular death and heart failure hospitalization
key_recommendations.evidence_summary: Recent trials show benefit regardless of diabetes status

clinical_guidelines.treatment_algorithm: Guideline-directed medical therapy should be initiated and optimized before considering device therapy or advanced heart failure treatments

clinical_guidelines.guideline_title: American Diabetes Association Standards of Medical Care in Diabetes - 2023
clinical_guidelines.scope: Comprehensive diabetes care including prevention, diagnosis, and management

key_recommendations.recommendation: HbA1c target <7% for most adults with diabetes
key_recommendations.evidence_summary: Reduces microvascular complications and long-term macrovascular events

key_recommendations.recommendation: Metformin is the preferred initial pharmacologic agent for type 2 diabetes
key_recommendations.evidence_summary: Proven efficacy, safety profile, and cardiovascular benefits

key_recommendations.recommendation: Consider GLP-1 receptor agonists or SGLT2 inhibitors for patients with established cardiovascular disease
key_recommendations.evidence_summary: Cardiovascular outcome trials demonstrate reduced MACE

diagnostic_criteria.diabetes: HbA1c ≥6.5% or fasting glucose ≥126 mg/dL or 2-hour glucose ≥200 mg/dL

clinical_guidelines.screening_recommendations: Screen all adults ≥35 years for diabetes/prediabetes every 3 years

clinical_guidelines.guideline_title: ACC/AHA Guideline on the Primary Prevention of Cardiovascular Disease
clinical_guidelines.organization: American College of Cardiology, American Heart Association
clinical_guidelines.scope: Primary prevention of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease in adults

key_recommendations.recommendation: Lifestyle modification is the foundation of cardiovascular disease prevention
key_recommendations.evidence_summary: Comprehensive evidence supports diet, exercise, and smoking cessation

key_recommendations.recommendation: Statin therapy for adults 40-75 years with LDL-C ≥70 mg/dL and 10-year ASCVD risk ≥7.5%
key_recommendations.evidence_summary: Multiple primary prevention trials demonstrate mortality benefit

key_recommendations.recommendation: Consider coronary artery calcium scoring for risk assessment in intermediate-risk patients
key_recommendations.evidence_summary: Improves risk stratification and treatment decisions

clinical_guidelines.risk_assessment: Use Pooled Cohort Equations to estimate 10-year ASCVD risk
clinical_guidelines.treatment_thresholds: Consider statin therapy when 10-year ASCVD risk ≥7.5% in patients 40-75 years
